headline: Fox Corp hits advertising revenue record in first quarter
summary: Fox Corp reported record Q1 advertising revenue of $1.4B, up 6% year-over-year, driving total quarterly revenues to $3.74B despite absence of election year political ads.

content.title: Fox Corp hits advertising revenue record in first quarter
content.summary: Fox Corp reported record Q1 advertising revenue of $1.4B, up 6% year-over-year, driving total quarterly revenues to $3.74B despite absence of election year political ads.

headline: Roblox, Fox, Kimberly-Clark: Trending Tickers

headline: FOX (FOXA) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of cable news and media network Fox (NASDAQ:FOXA) jumped 6.2% in the morning session after the company reported third-quarter 2025 results that significantly beat Wall Street's expectations. For the quarter, Fox posted total revenue of $3.74 billion, a 4.9% increase year on year, surpassing analyst estimates of $3.57 billion. The company's profitability was a standout, with adjusted earnings of $1.51 per share, which was 37.4% higher than the consensus forecast of $1.10. Adjusted EBITDA a

headline: Tubi Media Group and Audiochuck Announce Exclusive Partnership
summary: Tubi Media Group, a division of Fox Corporation (Nasdaq: FOXA, FOX), today announced a multi-year deal with Audiochuck, the award-winning media company founded by Ashley Flowers, for exclusive distribution and advertising sales rights on their top-rated shows Crime Junkie, The Deck, So Supernatural, Dark Downeast, Park Predators, and more. The agreement includes the development of a Crime Junkie FAST Channel to be distributed across FOX's streaming platforms Tubi and FOX One, as well as leading

headline: FOX (NASDAQ:FOXA) Delivers Strong Q3 Numbers
summary: Cable news and media network Fox (NASDAQ:FOXA) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 4.9% year on year to $3.74 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.51 per share was 37.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: FOX (NASDAQ:FOXA) Delivers Strong Q3 Numbers
content.summary: Cable news and media network Fox (NASDAQ:FOXA) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 4.9% year on year to $3.74 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.51 per share was 37.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: ‘Crime Junkie’ Company in Deal to Bring Podcasts to Tubi
summary: The true-crime podcast maker Audiochuck has signed a deal with  Fox  Tubi Media Group that will put video versions of the top-ranked “Crime Junkie” on the free, ad-supported streaming platform, the companies said.  Indianapolis-based Audiochuck’s podcasts will be distributed through Tubi and Fox One, Fox’s direct-to-consumer service that includes Fox News and Fox Sports.  Fox and The Wall Street Journal’s parent company,  News Corp  share common ownership.

content.title: ‘Crime Junkie’ Company in Deal to Bring Podcasts to Tubi
content.summary: The true-crime podcast maker Audiochuck has signed a deal with  Fox  Tubi Media Group that will put video versions of the top-ranked “Crime Junkie” on the free, ad-supported streaming platform, the companies said.  Indianapolis-based Audiochuck’s podcasts will be distributed through Tubi and Fox One, Fox’s direct-to-consumer service that includes Fox News and Fox Sports.  Fox and The Wall Street Journal’s parent company,  News Corp  share common ownership.

summary: NEW YORK (AP) — Fox Corp. FOXA) on Thursday reported fiscal first-quarter earnings of $599 million. On a per-share basis, the New York-based company said it had profit of $1.32.
